1.text: Find a large stock pot and a smaller metal bowl that will fit inside.

2.text: Line the bottom of the large stock pot with water.

3.text: Heat the water on the stove until it boils.

4.text: Place solid pieces of beeswax into the smaller bowl.

5.text: Nest the smaller bowl inside the stock pot after reducing the heat.

6.text: Allow the solid beeswax to melt slowly over the simmering water.

7.text: Pour the melted wax into a mold as soon as it completely liquifies.

8.text: Pour 2 to 3 in (5.1 to 7.6 cm) of water into the basin of your crock pot.

9.text: Place a small metal bowl inside the crock pot.

10.text: Set pieces of the solid beeswax into the small bowl.

11.text: Cover the crock pot and allow the wax to melt completely.

12.text: Pour the melted beeswax into molds once it’s melted down.

13.text: Line a styrofoam cooler with aluminum foil.

14.text: Place the solid pieces of beeswax in a metal or glass bowl.

15.text: Insert the bowl into your solar oven and cover it with a sheet of glass.

16.text: Set the solar oven in the sun and allow the beeswax to melt.

17.text: Remove the melted wax from its solar oven and pour it into molds.
